_exec_summary.SummaryText: EXECUTIVE SUMMARY OF RISK MANAGEMENT PLAN FOR UNITE COOPERATIVES INC.                                                 1.  THE FACILITY POLICY:  THE OWNERS, MANAGEMENTND EMPLOYEES OF UNITED COOPERATIVES INC. ARE COMMITTED TO THE PREVENTION OF ACCIDNENTAL RELEASEE OF ANHDROUS AMMONIA BY UTILIZATION OF PROPER EQUIPMENT, REGULAR INSPECTIONS AND MAINTENANCE AND TRAINING OF ALL PERSONS THAT WORK WITH THE MATERIAL.  SHOULD AN ACCIDENTAL RELEASE OCCURE, THE FACILITY HAS ORIENTATED THE LOCAL FIRE DEPARTMENT AND THE LEPC SO THEY CAN PLAN FOR RESPONSE TO ANY RELEASE AND MINIMZE THE IMPACT OF THE REELEAASE TO PEOPLE AND THE ENVIRONMENT.                                                                                                   2.  FACILITY INFORMATION:  THE PRIMARY ACTIVITY AT THE FACILTY IS THE STORAGE OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA FOR SALE TO FARMERS.    ANHYDROUS AMMONIA  IS RECEIVED, STORED, AND DISTRIBUTED FOR DIRECT APPLICATION AS A CROP PRODUCTION NUTRIENT. THE MAXIMUM QUANTITY STORED  IN ONE 18,000 GAL. AND 3-11,000 GAL. BULK STORAGE TANKS IS 223,000 POUNDS AND 223,000 POUNDS IN PORTABLE NURSE TANKS FOR A TOTAL OF 447,000 POUNDS ONSITE STORAGE..                                                                                                              3.  THE WORST-CASE RELEASE SCENARION:  NOT DISCLOSED                                                                                      THE -ALTERNATIVE CASE RELEASE SCENARIO: NOT DISCLOSED                                                                                  4.  THE ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PROGRAM:  THE FACILITY COMPLIES WITH THE RULES AND REGULATIONS RELATING TO THE HANDLING OF ANHDROUS AMMONIA AND LW PRESSURE NITROGEN SOLUTIONS,  EQUIPMENT, CONTAINERS AND STORAGE FACILITIES .  THESE REGULATIONS ADMINISTERED BY THE STATE OF MISSOURI ARE CONSISTENT WIT ANSI K61.1 AND OSHA 29 CFR 1910.111 REGARDING STORAGE AND HANDLING OF ANHDROUS AMMONIA              5.  THE FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY - THEE HAVE BEEN NO RELEASES FO

AMMONIA FROM THIS FACILITY IN THE PAST 5 YEARS.                                                                                                                                                                6.THE EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM:  THE FACILITY HAS A WRITTEN EMERGENCY ACTIONSPLAN IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE OSHA STANDARD 29CR 1910.38 AND PROVIDE STATE AND LOCAL AUTORITIES THE EMERGENCY PLANNIN AND COMMUNITY REIGHT TO KNOW INFORMATION AS REQUIRED UNDER SARA TITLE III OF EPCRA.  OUR EMERGENCY RESPONSE ACTION PLAN HAS BEEN REVIEWED WITH THE LOCAL FIRE DEPARTMENT AND PROVIDED TO THE LEPC FOR COORDINATION N THE COMMUNITY RESPONSE PLANNING.                                     7.  PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY:  SAFETY IMPROVEMENTS IS AN ON-GOING PROCESS AT THE FACILITY PERIODIC EVALUTATIONS ARE PREFORMED TO ASSESS THE MAINTENANCE OF SAFE PRACTICES AND OPERATIONS.  THERE ARE NO ADITIONAL SPECIFIC ANHYDROUS AMMONIA SAFETY REXCMMENDATIONS FOR IMPLEMENTATION AT THIS TIME.
